Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the Officer correctly apply the legal test for humanitarian and compassionate grounds?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Ms. Lopez Segura overstayed her visa, claimed abuse in Mexico, and applied for permanent residence on H&C grounds.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of H&C application denial
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Officer's decision was reasonable and aligned with applicable legal standards
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Overstayed visa and remained in Canada without status
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of abuse in Mexico, humanitarian and compassionate considerations
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Assessment of unusual and undeserved or disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Hardship upon return, risk, state protection, establishment in Canada
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Insufficient evidence of hardship or risk upon return
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Claims of abuse, family ties, integration efforts
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Lack of credible documentation supporting abuse claims
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Evaluation of disproportionate hardship under IRPA
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of risk or exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Outcome: H&C application denied; judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Perceived risk of abuse in Mexico not substantiated
Crimes.Cause_Description: Overstay of visa and fear-based H&C claim
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer assessed available evidence as insufficient
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of corroborating evidence for abuse claims
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer reasonably concluded no unusual hardship
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No unusual or disproportionate hardship established
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide sufficient documentary support

Crimes.Crime_Name: Making a refugee claim with knowledge of inadmissibility
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Assessment of H&C grounds including hardship, establishment, and best interests of the child
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Doubt regarding severity of hardship and risk claims
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Personal affidavits, country condition reports, school records
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Unusual or disproportionate hardship, best interests of the child
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Child’s ability to adapt in country of origin
Crimes.Application_Factor: Establishment in Canada, child’s best interests, hardship on return
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Correctness vs. reasonableness of legal test
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient evidence of hardship, risk, or exceptional establishment
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of objective evidence supporting hardship claims
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimant argued improper assessment of child’s best interests
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada – Federal Court review of immigration decisions
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Whether Officer conflated PRRA and H&C standards
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to establish key H&C factors
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Criminality or security-related inadmissibility not specified, but prior failed refugee claim implies possible bars

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the Officer correctly assess the H&C application and best interests of the child?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Ms. Lopez Segura overstayed, refugee claim denied, removal order issued, H&C application submitted post-removal
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal and permanent resident status on H&C grounds
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Officer’s decision reasonable based on evidence
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada after visa overstay and refusal of protection claims
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of abuse in Mexico, son’s ties to Canada
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Assessment of unusual or disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: State protection availability, internal flight alternative, child’s best interests
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of H&C refusal following removal order
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims of abuse and hardship not adequately substantiated
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Affidavits, family connections, child’s school records
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Officer found no significant hardship for child or mother
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Permanent residence and cancellation of removal
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Evaluation of H&C factors under IRPA
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of credible evidence demonstrating risk or exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Outcome: H&C application denied; removal order stands
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No unusual or disproportionate hardship found upon return to Mexico
Crimes.Cause_Description: Overstay, failed refugee claim, refusal of H&C relief
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer considered all submissions but found them unconvincing
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA - failure to leave after removal order
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant with immigration status and removal directive
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court authority to review immigration decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer reasonably weighed evidence and found no basis for relief
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Adequate state protection in Mexico; child’s adjustment feasible
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to meet burden of proof on hardship and risk
